CatDescriptText: Dan Mulvey, dental technician, North Side and Claudia Robinson, housewife, West End, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 4, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think there is immediate danger of a third world war?  Why? If so, whom do you think our allies will be?"  Mr. Mulvey's answer reads: "I don't think so, because neither side can afford to do so.  We know what Russia has, and they know what we have...Both sides realize that to start a war means the end of both."  Mrs. Robinson's answer reads: "Yes, because they keep talking about it.  I'm talking about the word exchange between Khrushchev and Ike."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Dan Mulvey wearing eyeglasses and dark suit jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Claudia Robinson wearing block patterned blouse, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
